Biography

2023 — Put together a solid second season, seeing action in all 13 games and making eight starts...totaled 27 receptions for 335 yards and a touchdown... played a vital role in the Paladins 10-3 season headlined by a SoCon championship, eight consecutive victories, and FCS quarterfinal round playoff appearance...squad was ranked sixth in the AFCA FCS final poll...had a season long 45-yard catch in season opening, 45-10 win over Tennessee Tech...had four catches for 68 yards, including a 40-yard reception, versus Kennesaw State (31-28 win)...had a leaping, one-handed one-yard touchdown catch on the final play of the first half to give Furman a 17-7 halftime lead in an eventual 27-21 road triumph over Samford...scoring grab versus Samford was part of a season high five-reception performance...caught three passes for 50 yards versus VMI (37-3 win).

2022 — Appeared in six games as a true freshman, recording three catches for 28 yards...credited with a 21-yard catch in a season opening, 52-0 blanking of North Greenville...also registered catches against both The Citadel and Chattanooga.

High School: 2022 graduate of The Woodlands (6A) High School...played wide receiver...football coach was Jim Rapp...served as a team captain for 2021 season, helping his squad to 8-3 campaign...earned first team all-district honors after catching 46 passes for 1,010 yards, and 13 touchdowns...finished his prep career ranked fifth in school history in receptions, receiving yards, and touchdown receptions...three-time academic all-district selection.

Personal: Full name is Benedict Louis Ferguson...born September 16, 2003, in Gulfport, Mississippi...son of Brad and Annie Ferguson...has a brother, Blaise...undeclared major.
